data.text:
The medium of film has garnered a wide variety of influences over its relatively short existence as an art form. However, as in all art traditions only a select few have made significant contributions and are hailed as influential figures. This concept is more difficult to define in film due to it being a collaborative process involving many people’s talent and hard work. Even so, the products that result can be tied to the director and the critical decisions they made regarding the film. In my opinion, the three directors I have chosen for their influence and significance are John Ford, Akira Kurosawa, and the Coen brothers.

One could simply state that John Ford influenced cinema by sheer volume as he directed over hundred movies over the …show more content…

However I am not sure why. I was hoping that by writing about them in an in depth manner would solve that particular conundrum but that has assuredly not happened. Hmm. Well, the John Ford and Akira Kurosawa both deal with similar subject matter involving men grappling with their inner selves as the world around them changes. Unsurprisingly, the Coen brothers are the odd ones out in this grouping with them applying whatever styles and themes fit with the project and may only have a few recurring motifs. The closest connection is that they take the elements that I love from Ford and Kurosawa and transform them into something completely new that feels like that is the way it should have always been. All the directors have that special quality that make me forget I am watching a movie then go back and make me figure out how every cut and movement did not take me out of that trance. Continuing, the movies that these people made were the first I considered more than just movies post-that time as a kid when you think everything is magic.
